benchmark_details.name: OPTIBENCH
benchmark_details.overview: OPTIBENCH is a benchmark for end-to-end optimization problem-solving with human-readable inputs and outputs. It contains rich optimization problems, including linear and non-linear programming with or without tabular data, which can comprehensively evaluate LLMsâ€™ solving ability.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of OPTIBENCH is to evaluate the capability of large language models to solve optimization problems end-to-end.

data.source: Data collected from textbooks and university assignments, manually verified for quality.

methodology.calculation: Performance is measured by the accuracy of the numerical answers produced by the models against ground truth values from the benchmarks.
methodology.interpretation: Performance is evaluated based on how well models can solve optimization problems with various constraints and objective functions.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4 achieved the highest accuracy, followed by Llama-3-8B-Instruct after fine-tuning with R ESOCRATIC-29K.
methodology.validation: The benchmark includes 605 diverse optimization problems created and validated through rigorous selection and expert review.
